description: From Spanish quinterón (“the offspring of a quadroon and a white person”).

entries.meaning: (dated) The offspring of an octoroon (1/8 black) and a white person: 1/16 black
(dated) The offspring of a mustiphini (1/16 black) and a white person: 1/32 black
examples: Some authors, who have treated on the West Indies, do not count so far; but the writer of this, has seen more than one family of Quintroons by Mustiphini mothers in a state of slavery; which of course, would not have been the case, had they been those persons called white by law.
